website_summaries.verdict: Featuring a well-padded interior and compartments for all of your equipment, this durable and good-looking compact bow case is an excellent deal for the price.
pros: Dedicated protective pockets for limb, risers, and arrows
Multiple colors available, including black, red, and camo
cons: The zipper on this compact bow case is fine, but a lockable option would have been a better option for traveling

customer_reviews.title: Too small, too short, misleading picture with the tube
customer_reviews.text: the quality is good and price is very appealing, however description is a bit misleading: 1. inside length is only 25", maybe 25 1⁄2 if pushed. 25" riser barely fits - see picture. 2. the riser pocket is too small and if you have a plunger attached it will NOT fit - see picture. 3. the last image with the arrow tube is misleading - there's no tube. Although it is mentioned in the description I think the tube on the image should be grayed out or at least marked 'not included' or something. Overall, it's a great bag but too small for my son's needs - sending back..
customer_reviews.author: Keleb the Dog

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple archery bag that does its job
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent affordable bag. You will want to purchase limb protection sleeves, like the SAS limb sleeves, if you are using this bag with ILF limbs. The riser and limb pockets keep the components separated but does not offer any limb to limb protection from the ILF attachment lugs. 1. The bag arrived quickly. 2. The bag and handles seem sturdy. 3. The zipper appears to be sturdy. 4. The arrow tube attachment straps work as they are intended. 5. The accessory pockets inside are sufficient. 6. My 19 inch ILF riser and medium length limbs fit inside the bag fine.
customer_reviews.author: Technical Expert

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it is designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: No padding, but if you just want to store the bow and some gear this is a great way to do it. It has two large mesh pockets inside, and a smaller zippered pocket on the outside. I pack all my archery gear in this, and attach my SAS Adjustable Archery Arrow case on it (They are designed to work together as one unit) and I have everything I need for a day at the range. When I travel I take all this with me in a Pelican case that I use as regular luggage. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jojo DFB

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 64" take-down recurve (barely). There are 4 pouches. Two long ones for storing the limbs and riser. Two other pouches in which you can store finger tabs, gloves, arm guards, stringer, bow strings, etc. There are outside straps for securing the arrow tube (sold separately) that is shown in the picture. I found that I don't need them for the arrow tube as it comes with it's own strap, which allow you to carry it on your shoulder or back. It worked out for me anyway. I ended up using the straps for my hip quiver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for a takedown bow
customer_reviews.text: The case is long enough to fit my 25” riser and the limbs fits snugly in the pocket. Plenty of room to fit a hip quiver and pockets for accessories and other personal items. The over the shoulder strap is also convenient. Overall does the well and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: HotPotJunkie

customer_reviews.title: looks nice but very thin
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking case. Looks like the picture but is very thin. It may have 1/8th inch of very flimsy padding. When a description says "fully padded" I would really expect some real "measurable" padding not a whisp of air. That padding is so thin it only has one side.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Williams

customer_reviews.title: SAS Recurve Takedown Bow Case (Black)
customer_reviews.text: Decent lightweight bag with some padding (just a little thicker would be nice!). Holds my Southwest Archery Spyder takedown recurve riser and limbs with no problem. The two large inside pockets were big enough to hold my bow accessories (stringer, extra strings, wax and a couple of paper dinner plates to be used as targets). Wish the outside zippered pocket was a bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Warren T

customer_reviews.title: Tight Fit, but sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a basic takedown bow that I am using. The pockets are TIGHT. My bow square will not fit anywhere comfortably. A nice case, but I wish the inside was reorganized a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D Rathbun

customer_reviews.title: one of the most popular beginner bows out there and it fits fine. Not long enough for arrows
customer_reviews.text: Works well for holding my bow. I have the samick sage, one of the most popular beginner bows out there and it fits fine. Not long enough for arrows, not that it has to be, and has more space than I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Decent. I got it today and it has a little zipper at the front. It also has a place to put in your take down recurve limbs and with two wider separated area for you t ok put the main body and other small equipments such as finger/arm guard, finger slinger and such.
customer_reviews.author: The experienced

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of space, great case!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for a 62" take-down Spyder recurve bow. This case easily fits the entire bow, and has several puches for my arm guard, finger tab, stringer, and bowstring. In addition to this, I have also been able to fit my SAS 3 tube quiver with 12 arrows in it while traveling to my destination, and a water bottle. Overall, perfect for what I need it for!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ostrum

customer_reviews.title: Recommended, but could be stiffer.
customer_reviews.text: Great overall case, but loses a star for softness of frame. It could use a harder insert on at least one side to keep the case from bending so much (stiffer). I would still recommend for a beginner case, especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: chalkoutline

customer_reviews.title: Alright for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic way of transporting your takedown. If you have a regular, basic wooden riser style takedown, I think it will work great. If it is one of the more modernized takedown with a modern-style riser, Just bite the bullet and get a backpack for it.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Is great for holding basic gear
customer_reviews.text: Is great for holding basic gear.... I have my recurve bow, an arrow case that I attach to it, my hip quiver, finger tab, finger sling and arm guard. It all fits and I have a tiny bit more space for some smaller items, too. If you have more than that, space may be a little challenging though. It is lightweight and not bulky. It is soft material, so if you're going to bang it around, this may not be a good case for that.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a take down recurve now case. Simple and easy to use. Could use more pockets but it’s plenty for a sub-$30 bag.
customer_reviews.author: JJ8987

customer_reviews.title: Holds large recurve!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy. Was hoping it would fit the few arrows I have but it doesn't. But holds my 68 inch bow!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ask about the length on the inseam. Good bag, though!
customer_reviews.text: The bag was very sturdy and well seamed. The only thing that's holding it back from a 5 star is that it was I couldn't fit my arrows in it. Partially, that's my fault for not asking about the inside seam limitations. It was a matter of 1 inch. But, it's a great bag!
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: An OK bag
customer_reviews.text: It would be a great bag if it had a little more padding for the limbs.
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: A very nice and protective bow case
customer_reviews.text: A very nice and protective bow case. Inside pockets and straps keep limbs/handle section from rubbing together and scratching finish. also pocket for strings and other accessories. Does what I need it to do. Store & protect Bow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient carry.
customer_reviews.text: Case is sturdy and made to last. Great protection for my bow and accessories. Worth the $$$$.
customer_reviews.author: Randy K

customer_reviews.title: perfect for Samick Sage takedown bow
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my older son; perfect for Samick Sage takedown bow, and associated gear. Nice quality, sturdy fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Soledad

customer_reviews.title: Just what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to transport my 64" recurve bow. Nice amount of pockets too.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Hassett

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect case! Easy to carry on my shoulder! I can take it off and on quickly and easily. Holds my bows perfectly. Made well with strong material. I highly recommend this case!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my Samick Sage takedown recurve bow. Plenty of extra space for my quiver and pockets for strings, stringer, glove and arm guard. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hook

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a good recurve case
customer_reviews.text: Nice case at a great price. Simple but works just fine for my new takedown recurve.
customer_reviews.author: Toney

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: perfect, used it 2 days after receiving it. all works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Don M.

customer_reviews.title: ... for a takedown bow I bought my nephew- he loved the color and holds the bow well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a takedown bow I bought my nephew- he loved the color and holds the bow well.
customer_reviews.author: SCB67

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife's bow and she loves it. Fits the 62" Spirit perfectly. She likes the soft case with pockets for the rest of her kit. Great buy, highly recommend. Thanks...
customer_reviews.author: Shadowfax

customer_reviews.title: SAS Recurve Takedown Bow Case
customer_reviews.text: Read the product description for details. I have a 68 inch recurve and it fits well. This is a great case for takedown bows.
customer_reviews.author: drobvit

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this case. Very lite weight. Would recommend. The inside of the bag hold a lot of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: tiggermommy

customer_reviews.title: in great condition, and fits my take down re-curve bow ...
customer_reviews.text: Order was delivered right on time, in great condition,and fits my take down re-curve bow fine. I paired it with my arrow case, (October mountain -OMP arrow guard, from SAS). I strongly recommend these products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds all the parts nice and snug but not to snug to be an ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds all the parts nice and snug but not to snug to be an issue. Only complaint I have is that the bow parts are stored in what I would consider to be the lid of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Jake M.

customer_reviews.title: Camo Version Looks Dope
customer_reviews.text: Looks awesome and fits my 62inch Spyder Recurve Bow perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Holds riser and limbs comfortably in separate pouches w/elastic band openings. Holds equipment in 3 smaller soft pouches w/elastic band openings. Compact stiff hold. Nice. Outside velcro pocket. Not long enough to hold arrows, I wouldn't recommend trying either - too compact on the inside. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: triggerr

customer_reviews.title: SAS Recurve Takedown Bow Case (Black) ...
customer_reviews.text: Good bag, simile to use and stores my SAS Spirit 66 bow easily.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: works fine. if youre a tinkerer get a bag that ...
customer_reviews.text: works fine. if youre a tinkerer get a bag that holds more
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Well made and plenty of storage pockets on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to fit a kids and an adults bow into one bag! Good quality!
customer_reviews.author: A. Neely

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good case at a great price. Seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store my take down recurve
customer_reviews.text: Great way to store my take down recurve. It's not much of a travel case because it has no padding.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great for take-down recurve bows and extras
customer_reviews.text: As long as you have a mid section that is 25 inches or less, than your take-down recurve bow will fit
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor (Brad)

product_meta.title: Southland Archery Supply SAS Recurve Takedown Bow Case
product_meta.description:
Overview:

The SAS Take-Down Recurve Bow Case is not only a great way for your recurve to travel in style, the handy zippered pouch in the front leaves plenty of room for accessories!

Highlights:

Fully Padded 
Soft Inner Material for Best Protection from Scratches
Limb and Riser Pockets 
Arrow Tube Holder in the Back 
Available in Black, Red, Blue 
Dimension: 10" x 26.5" x 2"

Package Content:

1 x SAS Recurve Takedown Bow Case

Notes: Arrow Tube is not included
feature_bullets: Fully Padded with Limb and Riser Pockets
Arrow Tube Holder in the Back (Arrow Tube is not included and can be purchased here: B00PZ112ZG)
Soft Inner Material for Best Protection from Scratches

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
